column1: Gubakha (Russian: Губа́ха) is a town in Perm Krai
column3: located on the Kosva River (Kama's tributary) 400 kilometers (250 mi) northeast of Perm. Population: 28

column1: It was founded in the mid-18th century as a settlement around an iron ore deposit. Around 1909
column2: it was known as Gubakhinskaya kop (Губахинская копь). Town status was granted to it in 1941.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column3: together with two work settlements and six rural localities
column4: incorporated as the town of krai significance of Gubakha—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. Being a municipal division
column5: the town of krai significance of Gubakha is incorporated as Gubakha Urban Okrug.

column1: The town's economy includes several industrial facilities producing coke
column4: toys and power.  An industrial base was built in Gubakha during World War II.  Equipment from an evacuated nitrogen fertilizer plant was moved to Gubakha.  Later
column5: German reparations were used to increase the capital equipment in Gubakha.  The plant was officially recognized as operational in 1955.  During 1957 the plant may have been one of the first in Russia to operate a gas coke oven. In 1964 the plant began producing Methyl(ethyl)amines which are necessary for rocket fuel.

column2: the industrial association made up of the various chemical production facilities was reorganized into a joint stock company called Metrafrax.  51% of the company stock was sold to employees.  Several agreements to build up waste treatment
column4: and to build apartment blocks and a brewing facility were also concluded.The Kizel State Regional Power Plant is located in Gubakha.

column1: Gubakha Coke has capacity to produce 1.3 million mt of metallurgical coke annually.  The plant has never produced at capacity.
The town has a medical school and an orphanage.
